TopicTitle: Some love for the Kerbalizer app?

Articles.Content:
Hi, I paid for and downloaded the Kerbalizer app for Android when it was released, and with the best wishes in the world to the guys at Squad... it's a completely terrible unresponsive mess on my 1st gen Nexus 7.

It's slow, doesn't respond to my inputs, and the rare times it does eventually respond it often selects an object on a completely different part of the screen. Rotating the Kerbal works... occasionally... and for a fraction of a second at a time. And I've never even managed to get far enough to save my Kerbal to Facebook or whatever, so who knows if that part of the app actually works. At first I thought this may just be teething problems, but there has never been an update to even try and iron out these links

Today I thought I would check how the app runs on my Samsung Galaxy Nexus, in case it's just my tablet that couldn't run it properly for whatever reason, but trying to download from the store gives a "couldn't install on USB storage or SD card" or an "incorrect package file" error. Is it still even supported? Is there ever any plans to update it or will this dead app remain on the Play Store for eternity?

I bought the app to support Squad, and for that reason I'm not asking for a refund or anything. All I want to know is will this app ever see love, or is it a lost cause?
Bump D: Anyone have any ideas about the future of this app?
Can you email Squad at [email protected] regarding this? As it's not something we can address, I for one would like Linux support but as it needs the Unity player that is up to Unity.
